Welcome to the ninth iteration of this thread! Ask your simpler game questions here, and see them answered (usually!) Also: now a sticky! (We should have done this with the last eight iterations of this thread...)

We use a particular format, so please be sure to number your questions and answers accordingly. Also, please attempt to search the forum before you ask; the answer may have been posted in a previous thread.


Format Example:

(Person with a question) Q1: If the ship moves, and we don't arrive at a planet, what happens to the planets we scanned?

(Person with an answer) A1: Those planets are lost forever, and you have to scan for new ones.

Q1: If I picked Tracker skill later and print the LIST in the same day, does it always contain 8 suspects? (e.g. that's all on day 5)
On july 22, 2014
[6826491]

A1: The list drops one suspect per day, until there is only one name on it. It is tied to the days of the voyage, not when Eleesha (or an Apprentice Stephen) learns the skill.

Q2: What do alien fruits do exactly? (not jumpkins, in particular we just got a kubinus, filandra, and a peniraft from our expedition ) do we eat them? plant them? bananas seem more useful, they give morale
On july 23, 2014
[8281990]

A2: You'll need to be a Chef or Botanist (or mush) to see the traits of alien fruits. They're a lot like pills: the effects are randomized from game to game. It's best not to blindly eat them because they can cause diseases or have negative effects, not only positive. On my last ship, for instance, a couple of the fruits would grant 1AP when you ate them, but would also give you food poisoning or tapeworm. Our Kubinus actually would make you lose 2 morale. Sometimes an alien fruit can have the same effects as bananas, but their plant matures faster, so you can start harvesting fruit quicker.

Short answer: it varies! Have an expert look at them and determine whether they're worthwhile to grow.
On july 23, 2014
[8039106]

thanks corn kobb , so it's like the pills, on each ship it has a different effect? our chef Stephen told us the properties !
On july 23, 2014
[6826491]
gotzeso it's like the pills, on each ship it has a different effect?

With the exception of Jumpkins, yes. Jumpkins can still decay after a few days, and may cause food poisoning like any other rotting consumable, but the base effects are always the same.
On july 23, 2014
Kyubey

A2 To add KOBB a little - but even Botanist/Chef don't see how long it will take a fruit to mature. Botanist will see that after planting in new tree stats, but not before. And that number can be very different for alien plants. I saw a plant, who matured in 2 cycles! But another wanted 44 cycles - more then even bananas.
On july 23, 2014
Robotee

Q3 If I buy gold, but don't pick skills until my gold is over, will I still keep the skill slots?
On july 23, 2014
[6826491]

A3: Negative. If you buy gold, and you filled the slots with skills, you will keep those skills until the end of your current voyage. If you haven't put skills in those slots, they're lost if your gold days run out.

On july 23, 2014
[7881960]

A4 really peanutz??? doesn't seems so. just check and answer (to myself ) seems that the Agoraphobia description should be "All Actions cost +1 :pa: ever, alone too!!. the movements costs +1 :pm: only in a crowd room (4 people counting the illness guy)" and the action should be what Mushpedia description (no move, no drop, no take).

am i wrong? not been agoraphobia on myself, just checked another human actions with that ill, maybe i'm wrong (again... )
On july 23, 2014
Peanutz
Mais pourquoi est-il aussi mÃ©chant ?

I had Agoraphobia on a recent ship, so yes, I'm sure. I could act normally as long as there were less than 3 people with me. When there were 3 crew members or more in the room with me, I was affected by the illness. For example, working on a research would cost me 1 AP to pick up the apron, 1 AP to access the terminal, 3 to participate, 1 to exit the terminal and 1 to drop the apron. Giving a mission in a dorm (I was Jin Su) would cost me extra AP to get up, open the mission window, send it and lie back down.

If I remember correctly, the only exceptions were actions that cost special action points. For example repairs cost 1 to technicians, so it only costs 1 AP to someone who has Agoraphobia, even if they don't have the skill.

Note that Agoraphobia also gives Vertigo, which prevents you from piloting.

Dzanek

Q8: If I eat a spored ration which makes me Mush, do I get PA from this ration? And if I go wash myself in the bobby-trapped Refectory, do I take damage from the water?
On july 24, 2014
[6826491]

A8: No, you don't get AP in that case. And yes, you'll take damage from showering in the sink, unless you have Splashproof. Also, if it's boobytrapped, using the sink to shower will destroy the spore used to trap the room, since you're Mush.
On july 24, 2014
Dzanek

But I mean if you have 2 spores in you and eat ration/go showering. How to take the Splashproof if you're still human?
On july 24, 2014
[6826491]

It would work like this:

You'd eat the spored ration, and become Mush. If the refectory was also Boobytrapped, then you will get two spores at once. If you shower after that (as Mush, using the sink) then you'd take the same damage as if you used a Dorm shower, unless you had the Splashproof skill.

If you're human, you will almost never take damage while showering...but there is an uncommon event that shocks you while taking a shower, regardless of whether you're human or Mush.
On july 24, 2014
Aerial

Q9 Mushpedia says that Creative skill works in combat and solving the Mad Kube. Is it true?
On july 24, 2014
[6826491]

A9: It works for any action that uses AP and can fail. However, it does not trigger for free actions, like using Shooter/Tech points, Eleesha's free searching with Observant, etc.

A10 Find in wiki - this is peace core.

A10: The DMZ Corepeace setting is what prevents humans from throwing grenades. When it's ON (blocked) then humans can't throw grenades, but Mush can. So if you use this skill, it won't change that setting to OFF (which is good for the Mush.)

A10: DMZ-CorePeace is a part of Neron's BIOS setting that makes Neron act nicely and makes humans not being able to use grenades when active.

Q57: What is the current policy on Multi-Teamsters? I remembered from late that it is forbidden to have 1 person multiple accounts, and they should talk to the mods if it's not the case, but how should others react to that?

So far I have reported it and made it low key with the others, as I'm more aware of their griefing potential than their "oh we share the same computer." On the other side, every time (about 3~) I have seen them, they were always inactive, so it might be me being paranoid.

On august 3, 2014
[6826491]

A57: As you said, players may only have one account. If they've been marked as Multi-Teamsters, they're already flagged by the system, so they'll need to contact the Mod Inbox in order to join another ship. Then they'll have to delete all but one account in order to play again, and that process takes a while.

Under normal circumstances, you do not need to report them, unless they start griefing the ship, or they break any other rules.

Q60 Can someone please explain how Lethargy functions currently?
On august 3, 2014
Kyubey

A60 As description says - you lie down, you wait 4 cycles without getting up at all and then you get 3ap/cycle instead of 2ap/cycle.
Sleeping 8 cycles will give you 4*2 + 4*3 = 20 ap
Sleeping 9 cycles will give you 4*2 + 5*3 = 23 ap - max efficintly.
If you sleep like that you can get 4-5 bonus ap per day.
Also you have max ap boosted to 24.

Q74 If all of your mush patner is dead (cleanly by human) and you're the only mush left, is telling them that you're a mush secretly against the rule?
On august 5, 2014
[4950627]
MoxrexQ74 If all of your mush patner is dead (cleanly by human) and you're the only mush left, is telling them that you're a mush secretly against the rule?

Do you mean like discretely hinting? If so people may see this and report you for it.
On august 5, 2014
[6826491]

A74: Revealing yourself as Mush is potentially sanctionable, and the SDF has access to the PM logs, as well. Even if they suspect you, you must deny, deny, deny - or just say nothing. Revealing yourself in a conversation (secretly or not) is playing against your team. Revealing yourself and asking to be cured is an even worse offense, because it is treated as surrendering. Never do this.

Now, if they've already caught you in the act, and are calling for your death, that's a bit different. You can try to mislead them into thinking there are more Mush, or use the opportunity to Transfer, and hope they kill your old body before you can do more damage. If you do nothing and just wait to be killed or cured, that's potentially sanctionable, as a Pathetic Suicide. No matter the odds, you must resist.

Under no circumstances are you ever allowed to offer or accept a cease fire, and you may never entertain the thought of being cured; asking for it is strictly forbidden. If they offer you the cure in exchange for your surrender, you can report them, for incitement to seriously spoil the game. Why is it sanctionable? If they can cure you because you surrendered, then both sides have broken the rules. You for surrendering, and them for offering the cure in the first place.

MoxrexQ76 What's the difference between sabotaging thing normally and using green jelly to make the thing break down?

Frieda is that you! D= Just kidding... <.<
On august 5, 2014
[6826491]

A76: The Sabotage action won't trigger a Neron announcement that the equipment is broken. Green Jelly does trigger an announcement, once it happens. Depending on the circumstances, you might want to prefer one over the other.

An example: With a very active crew, it might make more sense to use Green Jelly, because it might make it harder to track the people who have been through that room. With a highly inactive crew, you might be able to sabotage it directly, and they may not even notice.
On august 5, 2014
SummerMcLovin

A76: Another big difference is that Green Jelly is completely Invisible so can be used in a room full of people and/or covered with a Camera, while Sabotage is Secret so can only be used in a room with neither (unless you are sabotaging the Camera itself).

Q79: Is there a limit to how many hunters can spawn per wave?
On august 5, 2014
[6826491]

A79: I don't think there is a limit. The later in the voyage, the more will tend to appear per wave, generally speaking. The number of cycles between the waves also makes a huge difference, though. If you don't have ANY waves after the initial one, and literally days pass, the next wave you'll get will be huge by comparison to "average" sized waves for that day.

On a few ships of mine, we had exactly that happen. No waves after the initial one for the first few days, then on D3, we had 19 hunters. On another ship, 23 hunters on D4. 10-12 hunters for the second wave is common enough, if it's late on D2.

Moving the ship more often tends to trigger the smaller waves to spawn, and that consequently should reduce the possibility of huge waves early in the voyage.

Q84: In casting ship, are there any rules? Can the SDF look at your history in the casting ship and make decisions based on that?

A little early but I wanna know.
On august 6, 2014
Peanutz
Mais pourquoi est-il aussi mÃ©chant ?

The usual rules apply if the casting hasn't decided otherwise. You can't start killing other humans or cooperate as mush if the ship was supposed to be a classic ship, with normal mush hunting. But the casting can also decide to apply different rules. If everyone agrees, for example, you can decide that mush and humans can cooperate.

The SDF will only your at the ship if a report has been sent by someone from the ship. If you haven't followed the basic rules on a classic ship or the casting rules on a special one, then yes, they can make a decision based on that.

[6826491]

A87: You can think of it as a measure of how much the other players (from both teams, mind you) respected your performance during the game. If you thought they were a good organizer/leader, played their role particularly well, kept up the (player) morale during the voyage, and/or helped make the voyage particularly entertaining, then give them a like. Glory doesn't exactly measure these factors, but likes will certainly reflect their impact.

Q92: what are the rules of screenwatching? i and my little brother play mush and we ended up in a ship together and we made kind of a pact to not watch eachother's screens but i want to know if there are any ACUALL rules about it and similar stuff?
On august 8, 2014
Chime

In multi-player games like Mush some might pressure you to show them a screenshot of your game page to "prove" your innocence or situation. Using screenshots in this way is not prohibited by the rules, but the roleplay (PR) element is immediately lost when using screenshots so it is considered not within the spirit of the game and is discouraged.

I guess that works for that. But playing with your brother on the same ship might give you other troubles.
On august 8, 2014
[6826491]

A92: It's highly discouraged, since it could be easily exploited. If you accidentally find out that one of you is Mush, that sort of spoils the game, doesn't it? One of you might end up helping the other team, even accidentally. Even if you're both human, you're not supposed to know that outside of the game. So just try to avoid seeing each others' game, and play fair; don't discuss your ship with the other until it's over.

On a side note, did you get flagged as Multi-Teamsters on your current ship? If so, you'll have to contact the Mod Inbox in order to join another ship later. If you didn't get flagged, then don't worry about it. (Don't answer this question here, but keep it in mind.)

Miner101XQ92: what are the rules of screenwatching? i and my little brother play mush and we ended up in a ship together and we made kind of a pact to not watch eachother's screens but i want to know if there are any ACUALL rules about it and similar stuff?

A92b - Additional information here; KOBB and I are sisters (sharing a room!) and managed to get on the same ship once. Luckily, we were both humans, but make sure you are taking extra care not to share any information, because that would be communicating through outside sources, which I think is mentioned in the rules. However, it can be difficult. Especially if you are like us and like to share what is going on in the ship. Some tips to make sure you don't make anything unfair:
- Other than explaining game mechanics, never talk about your ship unless it's through the chat system or on-ship PMs - whether you are mush or human. That ensures that everything is still available to the mods if you should happen to get accused of anything. Game mechanics should be fine to talk about outside, since you can ask on the forum for help.
- Resist the urge. Again, because I help my sister (she's newer than I am), I often go to her to use what is on her screen to help explain it. Kind of ruins the game if you're a mush and see where something important is kept, or if you're a human and see that they're mush. And it wouldn't be a gray area like getting cured can be.
- Don't manage their time. Sounds simple, but you would not believe how hard it is not to nudge your sibling/roommate and go "You should probably check Mush" when something is going down. That could be the difference between life and death if they're being attacked, and if they wouldn't normally have gotten on then, it's totally unfair.

If you want to avoid trouble in the first place, never launch at the same time (being when one is on an open ship, not just actual time), or always choose the same character so you can't be placed on the same ship. It's really a lot easier. c:

psibertus

Q104: Is working on Mycoscan before mush selection a violation of neutral play?
On august 11, 2014
[6826491]

A104: It is not a violation. Any research that you can conduct prior to Mush selection is fair game, including the NCC Lenses.
On august 11, 2014
Misterme7

It isn't? It gives an advantage before the game starts. How would it be within the rules?
On august 11, 2014
[6826491]
Misterme7It isn't? It gives an advantage before the game starts. How would it be within the rules?

Because most ships fill up before it can be finished, and once Mush selection happens, most ships prioritize ASG/CS right away. A ship that prioritizes Mycoscan then delays the completion of the two primary anti-Mush researches, so it's really not a worthwhile tradeoff.

In the end, it's far less of an advantage than having the cameras set up in the dorms prior to Mush selection...and that's still considered fair game, too.

On august 15, 2014
[8039106]

A151 if no antispore gas has been done and mush roles were selected on day 2..
so mush team combined can pull a total of 4 spores per day

both mush pull 2 spores and spike the same 1 person, and both trap different shelves/terminals/ration.


>1 person has 2 spores now. say he by chance picks up a spore from a shelf. he is now mush, and it is still day 2. mush count=3. there is still 1 more spore on a separate shelf: another non-mush picks it up. he is at 1 spore. no spores on shelves anymore, no more sporse can be pulled for the rest of the day.


now its day 3 and all 3 mush team can extract a total of 4 spores. they each extract 1, and all 3 of them spike 1 person with 0 spores. mush count=4. the last spore is placed on a shelf. the previous person with 1 spore picks up the one on the shelf, his count is at 2.


now it's day 4 and all 3 mush team can extract another 4 spores (total, not 4 per person). they all spike the same nonmush person again. mush count=5. and the 4th spore is placed on a shelf. the previous person now with 2 spores, picks up the shelf spore and has been turned mush. mush count=6.

> now it's day 5... and there are 6 mush... by the end of day 5 at max there can be 7 mush

long answer, depends heavily on amount of research done, and chance-if people idle, if they catch shelf spores

A151 follow up. The skills selected by the mush may matter as well. If all the mush take infector and mycelium, then every mush means another spore each day.

Theoretically, start of D1 the alphas have access to 6 spores.

Mush A spikes C 2x, Mush B finishes C, new mush means a 7th spore; Mush B and Mush C can fully convert D, which means an 8th spore. Mush D can spike E twice.

Still theoretically, start of D2 the 4 player mush team has access to 8 spores.

Mush A finishes converting E (9 spores available), and spikes F once; Mush B finishes F (10 spores available); Mush C, D, and E together convert G and H (12 spores available); Mush F-H have only 2 spores left to play with, but I gets both.

Finishing the theory, start of D3 the 8 player mush team has access to 12 spores.

There are now 8 mush, and 7 convertible humans remaining, one already has 2 spores. There are more spikers than possible spores, so I won't bother to track who spikes who, but to convert the remaining 7, only 19 spores are needed and each conversion gives +1 daily spores. We have 12 spores, so 4 full conversions and a person with 2 spores: the new conversions give +4 spores (16 daily spores); 4 is enough to fully convert 2 more and gives 2 more spores to work with, so 14 of the 15 possible mush are mush, and that 14th has 2 spores.

Soon after D4 begins, only Chun is left as human.

Q152 What happens if I run out of gold days in the middle of a voyage? Will I keep all my skills? Will I have to choose my skills again?
On august 16, 2014
[4950627]
Daniel1310Q152 What happens if I run out of gold days in the middle of a voyage? Will I keep all my skills? Will I have to choose my skills again?

You will keep all skills until the end of the voyage.
On august 16, 2014
[6826491]

A152: If you have three or four skills selected, then you keep those assigned skills until the end of that voyage. Note that if you don't already have skills assigned to the third or fourth slot(s), then you will lose the unassigned slot(s). On your next ship, you'll only be able to select two skills.
On august 16, 2014
DannyMac

Q153: If I load more fuel into the tank, will it keep the hunters away for longer?
On august 16, 2014
[6826491]

A153: It won't. When you load fuel into the tank, the next jump the ship makes will use ALL of that fuel at once, which is why when you wish to go to a planet, it requires the exact amount of fuel as its distance from the ship. Moving the ship even a distance of 1 will cause half of the normal hunters to stop their pursuit (75% with the Trail Minimizer,) but you will usually have a new (smaller) wave arrive when you do. It's the moving that causes them to stop pursuit, not the amount of fuel used.

In addition to that, moving the ship will erase the planet(s) already scanned, except in the case that your destination is a planet...so make sure to plan it with your crew if you intend to move several times in a row.
On august 16, 2014
DannyMac

Thanks for the answers!

Q155: Is it possible for the mush to trap the coffe machine? If yes, will people be spored every time use it to get a coffe or only once?
On august 16, 2014
Chime

A155
Trapping works 'on' rooms not objects. You can trap the refectory and the next person coming to get a coffee will trigger that trap (pulling a coffee is a roominteraction). But the trap will be 'unloaded' by that. So he only get's that one spore you put in the trap.

He'll also get the spore by doing other room interactions like taking a ration from the shelf and you or your mush partner can trigger the trap aswell. But you won't get your spore back that way.

A155: As Chime said, with the Trapper skill you will only place the one spore in the Refectory so it will be triggered by picking up any item in there, cooking, using the Coffee machine, but nothing after that.
Fungal Kitchen can be used to put as many spores as you can into a cup of Coffee (although there's no need to do more than three, or four with Mushivore Bacteria researched), but again that is only that one cup.

The only 'infinite trap' is Schroedinger, who will infect someone with one spore every time he scratches them. Damn, that one got ninja-d.

Peanutz
Mais pourquoi est-il aussi mÃ©chant ?

All physiological illnesses (the ones with a green icon) disappear in a few cycles, sometimes only one cycle. The number of cycles is random.

Psychological illnesses can only be cured by a shrink, sometimes by fruits or pills. The only exceptions, as far as I know, are Vertigo and Spleen, which can disappear without any treatment.

A168: It's not something the SDF would ever advocate, and it's strictly against the rules. It is best to never give even the slightest hint that they might surrender, via RP or otherwise. It's sanctionable, because a surrender of any sort ultimately spoils the game. By the same token, the humans can't offer the Mush the cure if they give themselves up. That is sanctionable as "incitation to seriously spoil the game" - in other words, asking the other team to play against their team.

Q181: Is it truth that Observant in cycle change has 25% chance to find a covert action if it happened in the past?
On august 23, 2014
Peanutz
Mais pourquoi est-il aussi mÃ©chant ?

No, it isn't. Observant can only reveal covert actions (like spiking) when they happen. It has 25% chance to act as a camera, but not for past actions, only simultaneous ones.

Observant can also notice (not reveal) secret actions that happened in the past (eating, hiding, extracting a spore...). But only if these actions were already visible in the logs because they were revealed by a camera or by someone else.

What will happen, if I take drone with Pilot upgrade with me to patrol ship on cycle change?
a) On cycle change there are still charges and hunters
b) There are no charges or all hunters are already killed by me

On august 25, 2014
[7950824]

A186: I answer from wiki, forums, and what I have been told by experienced players, I've never played with pilot drones myself.

a) Pilot drone doesn't care you are in the fighter; it has targets and charges and is in a ship: It fires. If turbo, it tries to fire twice if possible; if not possible it attempts to land.
b) It still doesn't care you are in the fighter; it cannot fire so it lands. If turbo, it then tries to either take off in a ship with charges, or move out of the room if turbo works.
c) It lands the ship. However, cargo you might have collected is not discharged; in order to actually get access to any scraps you had collected, someone will have to take off in the Pasiphae and manually land like normal.
d) No damage to you or ship if the drone lands the fighter; it does know how to pilot and you are not actually doing it.
On august 25, 2014
MinerX

Q187: Do rebel bases progresively get harder (like day 1 being easiest and day 7 being hardest) or do they all give same % upon 2 AP use (or are they influenced by randomness?)?
On august 25, 2014
[7950824]

A187 There's a ton of randomness. Two factors can reduce the difficulty by half (improve the % gained by 2x): One is a specific xyloph, the other is a skill Paola can have. Those do stack, making it possible (but unlikely) for Paola to decode rebel bases with just one try (2 AP). Realistically, it will usually still cost her 4 AP with both of those advantages. 4-6 AP is reasonable for most of the bases with only one of those advantages, and without either, 8-12 AP per base is pretty common.
On august 25, 2014
MinerX

On august 26, 2014
[7950824]

A190: Disease can affect any undiseased plant at any cycle change, it's possible (though unlikely) for disease to strike every cycle change; thus cure disease as close to C8 as possible (C8 is perfect).

Watering can be done any cycle without risk of having to water extra, plants only thirst at day change.
On august 26, 2014
[6826491]

A190: Disease can happen more than once in a day, but being thirsty/dried out will not recur once the plant is watered for that day. In short, if you treat a plant between D1-D7, you must check it again for disease in C8.

On august 27, 2014
[6826491]

A195: A few points: First, the tutorial can be repeated, and experienced players sometimes do that in order to pretend to be new.

Second, this game is all about communication. Sometimes hours, even minutes, can make all the difference between whether someone lives or dies. It can also be difficult to tell if someone is truly a newbie, or just pretending to be one.

With that in mind, this is something of a sink or swim environment. Players will either learn to communicate when they are active, or pay the price with their lives. Hopefully, they will learn quickly. If there is reason and evidence to suspect someone, they're probably going to die.

On august 29, 2014
[7950824]

A201: Quoted from wiki:

Participating in the repairs costs 1 PILGRED Repair Point or 2 Action Point. Each repair attempt will advance the total project by a random amount based on the character's Skills.
9-13% for a player with both Icon Physicist and Icon Technician skills.
5-7% for a player with either Icon Physicist or Icon Technician, but not both.
1% for anybody else (best used only to reset another player's efficiency).

AP to hack is largely random; hacking is a bit like repair. Base chance to hack is 25%. For characters with the IT skill, it's doubled. A transfer into the current commander can make hacking a non-issue. But don't forget you'll need 2 AP to actually jump the ship to Sol/Eden.

You do not need to be clean to use the command terminal and move the ship.

A202: At first time and just after relaying: If Raluca is Physicist and Technician, 9-13%. If Raluca is Physicist or Technician, 5-7%. If none of them - 1%. And if nobody relay, her next advances decrease by 2-3% till they reach 0%. So advances: 9-13%->7-10%->5-7%->3-4%->1-1%->0-0%.

If she reads mage book of IT Expert at first, it'll be 6-10 AP, mean chance: 50%->74%->99%. Reading mage book, attempt to hack and returning to Sol - all of them cost 2 AP.

You may pilot if you're dirty.

[7950824]

A211 Jumpkins and bananas both stop starving; it's as if they don't give 0 satisfaction, but as if they take you to 0 satisfaction, if you were already counting cycles to starvation. So you can eat a jumpkin or drink a coffee, then wait 23 cycles before you eat another jumpkin or coffee, and you'll never reach starving ever if you repeat that cycle.

A220: Glory does not determine victory for either side.

Humans win if: They get back to Sol with no Mush left alive. That's the basic human victory condition.

It's better if they get to Sol with the cure, and it goes without saying that getting to Eden without Mush is a major victory.

The Mush win if: The ship is destroyed by any means, there are no humans left alive, or if they manage to get living Mush to infiltrate Sol or Eden (with or without the cure researched.)

Q248: Berzerk Mush doesn't allow do to actions in the room it is. Which action? Whom (anyone, even Mush partners and itself)? And what's the difference between Berzerk Mush and guarding person?
On september 13, 2014
[7950824]

A248 A berserk mush is automatically also guarding the room which the berserk mush is in. This is an automatic state which doesn't cost additional AP for the mush to use. It is functionally identical to a human guarding, in terms of what actions other players may use while in the same room as the berserk mush.

The differences between a berserk mush and a guarding human is that if the guarding human leaves the room, the guard state is broken, and the human is not automatically guarding the new room, though that human may spend an AP to start guarding again. A berserk mush is always guarding the room they are currently in, and does not spend AP to return to this state, nor can they break their guard simply by moving, as a human can. Note that a berserk mush who wishes to 'stop guarding a specific room' effectively stops guarding it by leaving that room, but they are now guarding their new room instead.

On september 14, 2014
[7950824]

The only thing guarding prevents is exiting the room except back the way you came.

You can launch any sort of ship while in a room being guarded (even though that is technically a way to leave the room that may be different from how you entered it), but that gives you a neat problem when you land.... you are now tagged as having entered the room by way of that ship. So if the room is still guarded, now the only thing you can do, movement-wise is launch again.

Mush, mutated or not, are not immune to the guard skill, however a character with the sneak skill can move through a guarded room as if there was no guard (Chun is the only character who normally has that skill, so it's very rare that a mush has it).

Mush can do covert actions when there's another mush in the room, but these actions are revealed on the roomlog exactly as they are when there's another non-mush in the room.

Guarding only costs the guarder AP (unless mutated mush), and prevents leaving a room except from the direction you came. Otherwise gameplay is normal.
On september 14, 2014
Peanutz
Mais pourquoi est-il aussi mÃ©chant ?

Mush, mutated or not, are not immune to the guard skillActually, mutated mush are immune to each other's guard skill. If they guard a room, other mutated mush can go through the room as they like. I'm not completely sure, but I think that they're not affected by a human or non mutated mush guarding a room either.

You mean secret actions, I suppose. Covert actions can only be seen by cameras or by Eleesha (human, mush, or mutated) with the Observant skill.

[7950824]

A250 follow up; one other thing you should not do as mush is purposefully teach (or mislead) newbies into behaving as griefers, especially not with the understanding that they are playing well in doing so. That's something that the new player may well take to future ships and cause and get into trouble from.

mawgrint, there's a few reasons why that might not be a truly horrible thing to happen, for Frieda or anyone. For one, Frieda may well be able to speak up and save herself, especially if she's behaved rationally all ship. The rest of the people on the ship may be thinking 'transfer?' or 'radio pirate?' and not 'run and kill without checking anything else'.

For two, lets say that people immediately report Frieda, whether she is also killed or not. Once the ship ends, the report(s) are viewed by judges. The details you've mentioned sound pretty simple and obvious to understand, a few judges will spend a few minutes to check, will see what actually happened, and will clear Frieda, without any concerns that the reports were abusive either, and no one will receive any sanctions. Nor will the judges or mods be upset or inconvenienced - Clear fast cases with no wrongdoing from accused or accuser are not a burden, and remember, there is a difference between 'reported' (Check this out, please!) and 'sanctioned' (This has been checked out, and punishment is appropriate).

Without any desire to encourage abusive reports, I have to say that I strongly encourage appropriate reporting. If anyone thinks they see a rule being broken, I'm glad if you discuss it with the person doing it (should you choose to) and report it. Communication is very useful for the ship as a whole, and checking stuff out, teaching the rules, and ensuring that problems do not stay problems forever.... that's what the SDF is all about. That process starts with a report, and checking some innocent people, and declaring them innocent is just part of the path to finding those who need a 'heads up' warning about proper play and those who need a 'time out' because of repeated rule violations.

On september 14, 2014
[7950824]

Nope. Saying there's certain rules that apply differently, based on which role the person currently has - mush or human. Mush have a far greater freedom to act then humans do; there are things which are lawful for mush to do but not ok for humans to do - and also the opposite. And that there are circumstances that affect when certain rules are broken or not.

Also, that this is largely common sense stuff, and you really need to know the whole story of the situation to know what is right and wrong. Here's an example:

We are on a ship, and we see this message appear:

Frieda: I'm a mush on the bridge. I've hacked in. In 2 minutes I jump to Sol - kill me first if you can!

With only those details, I cannot tell you if any rules have been broken. They sure look like they have, at a glance. So if you see that message and report it - I'm not going to have a problem with the report, even it that was a totally appropriate comment to make.

So lets walk through what matters:

Did Frieda actually create the message and is Frieda a mush? If Frieda is a human and made that message, it's rulebreaking.

If Frieda did not make the message, Frieda didn't break any rules about the message regardless of if she is mush or human.

If Frieda is a mush and made that message, it could be rule breaking - here's an example of when it wouldn't be: There's one human left and Frieda knows the human has already used up all their AP and cannot do anything about her message. Taunting is not against the rules. Even revealing yourself to be a mush is not, explicitly, against the rules - the rule is 'don't play against your team'. If you see a way or a time to reveal yourself as mush that does not harm the mush team.... that's not a broken rule. But if your play is reported, several sets of eyes are going to be giving your play a hard look to see if they agree that in that circumstance, you played within the rules.

Here's another legal way for mush Frieda to make that message - she then transfers out of Frieda with the Frieda body set up to be slain. There are risks, but it's potentially good play, depending on all the other circumstances.

Q254 What is the use of leveling to the max mush skills?

On september 15, 2014
SummerMcLovin

A254: The thing about being able to choose when these things happen is that you can also base it around other factors. You can either wait for the right circumstances or create them yourself.

Fires can be set just before cycle change in the Refectory, Medlab, Lab/wherever the plants are to burn up some valuable objects, or you can Dismantle/Hide/steal the Extinguishers and start loads of fires so that the ship burns to destruction. Single fires (unless well-timed with cycle changes, but even then it is going to be difficult) are pretty suspicious, but most strategies I've heard are pretty game-ending when they work.

Massive Mushification is most useful when both Showers have been Dismantled. Research is going to take a couple of days to get started via the sink (Comms, Astro, Projects will have to wait even longer) and if there happens to be a noob who uses that day's... well it's worth doing. It might be suspicious that it has happened, but everyone is Dirty so you can get away with it - particularly if you transfer out of the Tech that Dismantled the second shower.

The only 2 ways to get human skills reseted - transfer skill (both for mush and his target) and being cured by RFS if you are mush. You don't lose human skills and cannot repick them if you are choosen as mush or if you were infected.

On september 26, 2014
Peanutz
Mais pourquoi est-il aussi mÃ©chant ?

Because mush don't get AP from rations, coffees and other consumables.

You can gain AP by several means :
- Phagocyte (eat a spore, which gives you 4 AP)
- Missions from the commander
- Sleeping
- Paola or Jin Su's Logistics skill

Infection

Q281: What does charges means? I have a young banana tree and it says it got charges. And it also says charges are number of times i can use the object. How do i use it? But Banana tree does not have charges only young ones have.

Q282: Does cross breeding takes time? Cause we got hydroponic incubators and it says it cross breed twice faster. How much time does it take? I know we need alien fruits for this. Can it fail after the cross breeding process?
On september 26, 2014
Kyubey

A281 Every cycle a young tree gets +1 charge, when number of charges reaches X. plant matures. X is seen by botanist. For banana it's 36 by default (incubator will make it faster). For alien trees X is random for every game.

A282 Cross breed will instantly give you young tree of new type, you need to be clean, target plant must be watered and cured. If those conditions are met - cross-breed is 100% successful. If you did anything wrong - 100% fail - you lose tree and fruit.

Hydroponic incubators will make any young tree to mature faster (description is a bit mitaken, not only those that were cross-breeded, but any). If you have young trees - just put them in garden.
On september 26, 2014

[7950824]

Infection- yes. If your young plant is in the garden at cycle change and you have hydroponic incubators, then it gets +2 charges every cycle change. Otherwise it gets +1 charge. It's been a while since I was a botanist, and I don't remember if 'needed cycles' is total or what's left over, but if you can wait a cycle and check them again, it should be easy to tell.

On september 28, 2014
Peanutz
Mais pourquoi est-il aussi mÃ©chant ?

There's a simple explanation to that limit, actually. With 4 possible directions (East, North, West, South) and 8 possible distances (from 2 fuel to 9), you have a total of 32 planets, which is the maximum of planets that can be scanned by all crew members at the same time.
